qas.question: In what case can a referee choose to end the match?

answers.text: when they or official ring physician decides that a wrestler cannot safely continue the match

qas.question: What is one reason that a wrestler may not be able to continue?
Why couldn't Shawn Michaels defend himself?

answers.text: due to excessive blood loss and impaired vision

qas.question: Where did Chris Jericho win in 2008?

context: A referee may stop the match <a0_0>when they or official ring physician decides that a wrestler cannot safely continue the match<a0_0/>. This may be decided if the wrestler cannot continue the match due to <a1_0>an injury<a1_0/>. At the <a3_0>Great American Bash<a3_0/> in 2008, Chris Jericho was declared the winner of a match against Shawn Michaels when Michaels could not defend himself <a2_0>due to excessive blood loss and impaired vision<a2_0/>. At NXT TakeOver: Rival in 2015, the referee stopped the match when Sami Zayn could not defend himself due to an injury sustained against Kevin Owens for the NXT Championship.
